ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: The course has a strong focus on new music techniques and music technologies, which are quite useful to learn about.

Knowledge of a musical idiom of my choosing culminating in several composition projects over the course of the semester, exploration of what it actually means to be a composer/film composer, knowledge of several DAWs, notation softwares etc, how to talk about my music
This course is an amazing opportunity to compose whatever you want and get credit for it! Konrad is so nice and the class is very easygoing
Learned about the lives of professional composers, what the process of composing actually looks like.
Not too much about actual composition. Listened to faculty music a lot during class.
I learned a lot about music technology that I hadnt learned before.

- More experience composing in a variety of styles
- Better music technology skills
- Feedback from peers
- 1:1 instruction in composition lessons
I learned a little bit about music technology and writing for prepared piano, in addition to furthering my skills and experience in music composition overall.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
The strength of composition seminar lies in the incredible freedom given to students to work on their own projects in any style and manner they prefer.
However, sometimes the guest presentation can be a hit or miss.

Strengths: it is a wonderful opportunity to work on music you like and get credit for, lessons are wonderful, the labs have a ton of helpful software and things, visiting composer lectures were usually very interesting  
Weaknesses: none especially, the structure of the class is quite unique but probably optimized for what it is

Strengths: Good Support Systems, One-on-One Lessons

Weaknesses: Wish that the classes focused more of actually technical considerations when composing, I had almost no experience going in and wish I had more explicit guidance on how to write sheet music.
Weakness: not too much actual learning about composition during class

Strengths:
- detailed feedback from lesson instructors and the ability to get ideas and inspiration from lessons
- guest lecturers who are working in the industry, especially Jay Wadley
- student presentations and feedback from profs

Weaknesses:
- the music school guest speakers felt a bit random and incohesive with the rest of the course, and therefor were less engaging

Strengths: With Konrad, composition seminar is very laid back and relatively forgiving. If youre busy with other classes it doesnt take a lot to do well in this course. Additionally, this class is really accommodating to a wide variety of different styles of music, so if you compose jazz, classical, pop, or something completely different, you should be able to complete this class without difficulty!
Weaknesses: At times, feedback and guidelines for projects can be unclear/minimal. Additionally, though presentations are interesting, the amount we learned pertaining to composition skills was quite variable I enjoyed being in the class but I dont know what skills I necessarily learned this semester. Lastly, the group projects can be rather tedious or outright painful we had a project for prepared piano which we were required to perform, which was quite the challenge!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If you have clear ideas about the music you want to make absolutely. It is very much self paced and directed and it is difficult to "learn" how to compose - the expectation seems to be that you will roughly have some ideas about what you want to do (which is probably for the best). So for anyone who wants to compose something, absolutely!

100%! I loved being in a space with other students interested in composition and being able to have composition lessons every week with my TF, who was amazing. You definitely get as much out as you put in - I decided to put in a lot this semester, and I feel like I learned/grew a lot as well.
I'm not a music major, so I took this as a fifth class, would recommend to someone self-motivated to write music for the entire semester.
I would recommend to a student interested in composition, especially aspects that seem a bit more practical.

YES! If you want to compose but need deadlines to get anything done, you should absolutely take this course. I tried using a ton of techniques that were new to me, and I feel really proud of my work in this course. The profs are super supportive and the lessons are so helpful!

If you like composition, and are very self-guided and self-motivated in your studies, then yes I would recommend this course. If youre looking for an easy class then this might be for you. But I wouldnt recommend this course for those who want clear cut assignments, rubrics, and grading.
